name: HD 180314
scenarioDescription:
The HD 180314 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 180314 is a star with 2.2 times the mass of the Sun, and 8.13 times its radius. It is located 400.49 light years away from the solar system.

HD 180314 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 180314 system


HD 180314 b

HD 180314 b was discovered by the Subaru Telescope observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.46 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 180314 b is 6401.339999999999 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 180314 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 180314, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Subaru Telescope.
